gpt_university_description: Cracow University of Technology, also known as Politechnika Krakowska, is a highly respected institution in Poland offering a wide range of technical, engineering, and architectural programs. Established in 1945, the university has become a major academic hub and research center that strives to provide cutting-edge education.
gpt_nearest_airport: John Paul II Kraków-Balice International Airport
gpt_location_cost_of_living: Krakow is generally considered an affordable city in comparison to other major European cities. Students can expect to spend around 500-900 USD per month on living expenses, depending on their lifestyle.
gpt_location_weather: Krakow experiences a temperate oceanic climate, with mild summers and cold winters. Average temperatures range from -2°C in January to 19°C in July, with occasional snowfall during winter months.
gpt_location_description: Krakow, located in southern Poland, is a beautiful, historical city known for its stunning architecture and quaint cobblestone streets. Rich in culture and art, the city offers a lively and vibrant atmosphere, with numerous attractions, such as Wawel Castle and the Main Market Square, along with a vibrant dining and nightlife scene.
gpt_location_crime: Krakow has a relatively low crime rate and is considered safe for tourists and students. However, as in any major city, it is advisable to be vigilant against pickpocketing and other petty crimes, especially in crowded areas.
gpt_location_transportation: Public transportation in Krakow is efficient and reliable, with an extensive network of trams and buses connecting various parts of the city. Students can benefit from discounted fares by obtaining a student ID card.
